com.decoded.zool

Class ZoolDataFlowImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.decoded.zool.ZoolDataFlowImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ZoolDataFlow, ZoolDataSink, ZoolWatcher, java.lang.Runnable, org.apache.zookeeper.Watcher

    public class ZoolDataFlowImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements ZoolDataFlow
    The ZoolDataFlow accepts Zookeeper data, and directs it to each DataSink listening for data via node name. ZoolDataFlow is a 1:1 object with a zookeeper instance. Meaning it handles all nodes from the root of that Zookeeper. When running multiple ZooKeeper Quorums, you can create multiple DataFlow. Each will be its own silo of zookeeper data and events. The default binding is an eager singleton

    bind(ZoolDataFlow.class).to(ZoolDataFlowImpl.class).asEagerSingleton();

    However, Guice provides injection capabilities to do named singletons etc. You can use the setHost(String) and setPort(int) methods to update the connection string (before calling connect()!)

    For details on the basic API:

    See Also:
    ZoolDataFlow

      • onData

        public void onData(java.lang.String zNode,
                   byte[] data)
        Description copied from interface: ZoolDataSink
        The main drain method. Data recieved on the path will be directed here.
        Specified by:
        onData in interface ZoolDataSink
        Parameters:
        zNode - the event path (as part of zookeepers structure, this is passed in). It must be equal to the path that was assigned upon creation of the data sink, or it should not be handled by this sink.
        data - the incoming data.
